justification: The text states that Figure 6 presents data for "the Vineland Adaptive Behavior Scale (VABS) adaptive functioning scores," indicating VABS is the tool used to assess adaptive functioning.

The reference to Lord et al. (2000) describes the Autism Diagnostic Observation Schedule as "A standard measure of social and communication deficits associated with the spectrum of autism," showing ADOS is used for measuring autistic symptomatology.
The article lists "Test of playfulness" (Skaard & Bundy) among its cited tools, linking the construct of playfulness with this specific measurement instrument.

The citation "Quantifying peer interactions for research and clinical use: The Manchester Inventory for Playground Observation" demonstrates that this inventory is employed to measure peer interaction behaviours.

Fink et al. are cited as examining "the psychometric properties of a new child self-reported playfulness scale" in a study of "dispositional playfulness in young children," indicating this scale measures dispositional playfulness.
